result.execSummary:
The defendant Mang YANG was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mang YANG is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mang YANG was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Mang YANG was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes.
Interpreter Voucher
RE:  Larry Hintz, on 11-05-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree recklessly endangering safety, fleeing an officer and OWI - 2nd offense.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-17-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that  he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department and Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety and not operate a motor vehicle.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination. (2)
Minutes.
